title: Airporter Shuttle
description:
Ride to and from Sea-Tac Airport & downtown Seattle. Also intercity travel for Marysville, North Bend, Seattle, SeaTac, Stanwood. 
Adults 16 and older ride at a flat rate. Youth between 2 and 15 years old ride at a lower rate than adults. Children 2 and under ride free. Riders age 15 and under need a release form. Riders age 12 and under must ride with adult.
advance-notice-notes: If you have ADA requirements, call at least 24 hours in advance, to ensure a wheelchair-accessible bus for your trip.

cost-senior: Flat Rate
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: A discount, on certain trips, for passengers 60 yrs old and older and for US military personnel/dependents with a valid military ID (Merchant Marines is not a branch of the US military). 10% discount for groups of 4 or more with a prepaid reservation. See website for details.
website: Visit the Airporter Shuttle site to learn more

title: American Cancer Society Road to Recovery
description: The American Cancer Society Road To Recovery program provides transportation to and from treatment for people with cancer who do not have a ride or are unable to drive themselves. Patients must be traveling to an appointment required to begin or complete cancer treatment, or to an appointment for complementary therapy during cancer treatment. Transportation cannot be provided for follow-up appointments after treatment has been completed. Patients under the age of 18 must be accompanied by a legally responsible adult such as a parent or caregiver. Spanish and English interpreters available.
advance-notice-notes: 4 business day advance notice is required, not including the date transportation is needed.

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Volunteer drivers provide for free
website: Visit American Cancer Society's site to learn more

title: American Parkinson's Disease Association (APDA) Ride Repay Program
description: Use the transportation of your choice to go to a doctor's appointment, visit a friend, or where ever you wish (no limitations on your travel). APDA will reimburse you up to $300 per year for eligible travel expenses such as taxi, bus, ferry, or rail fare or gasoline expenses. Fill out the application at APDA website or call 206-695-2905. In order to be eligible, you must have a Parkinson's diagnosis.
advance-notice-notes: This is a reimbursement service.
website: Visit the APDA site to learn more

title: Amtrak
description: Get your train and bus tickets or other Thruway services on Amtrak.com to travel over 500 destinations via 30 plus train routes in the USA and Canada.
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-adult: Dependant on route and time chosen
cost-youth: Dependant on route and time chosen
cost-senior: Dependant on route and time chosen
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: See website
website: Visit the Amtrak site to learn more

title: Around The Sound
description: Specializes in providing transportation services for citizens with disabilities. We perform same day, advance reservation, subscription, charter, and excursion transportation.                                                                           We perform our service on-time and within budget. Drivers  are fully trained and certified. VA approved to provide cabulance transportation when eligible. Riders under 12 must ride with adult.
advance-notice-notes: Reservations made on space available basis. Prefer 1 day advance notice but will attempt to provide transportation with less than 1 day notice.

cost-senior: Time + Mileage + Mobility Requirements.
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Inquire about discounts
website: Visit Around the Sound

title: Catholic Community Services - Disabled Veterans Transportation
description: The Disabled Veterans Transportation Program provides disabled veterans living in Snohomish County the ability to access essential appointments. Our volunteer drivers provide rides originating in Snohomish County and ending at select destinations, such as the VA hospital in Seattle or clinics located in Mount Vernon and Lake City. No permanent address is required. Disability need not be service related. Can drive anywhere outside of Snohomish County within 1 day's drive of residence, but must live in Snohomish County. Trips to the commissary, grocery store, food banks, and personal hygiene appointments are also accepted.
advance-notice-notes: 1 week notice

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: No cost if one qualifies, but donations appreciated.
website: Visit the Disabled Veterans Transportation website

title: Catholic Community Services - Mustard Seed Senior Transportation
description:
The Mustard Seed Project is a grassroots community agency serving Key Peninsula. The work of the project is to build an elder-friendly community by assuring that a full continuum of services and programs is available and affordable to people living on the Key Peninsula. The vision is to allow individuals to “age in place” with dignity, respect, self-determination and safety.
In partnership with Catholic Community Service’s Volunteer Chore Services, the Mustard Seed Project has recruited volunteer drivers to serve local seniors, disabled adults, and others in need of transportation. Scheduling and dispatch of drivers is handled by Volunteer Chore Services, but the volunteer drivers are local Key Peninsula residents.
Contact information: To find out if you qualify for transportation services through the Mustard Seed Project, please call Maureen Reilly at (253) 884-2216.
advance-notice-notes: 7 Days advanced notice required for evening rides.

cost-senior: Free (60+)
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Visit the Senior Transportation website

title: Catholic Community Services - Volunteer Services
description:
Volunteer service including transportation for people 60 years of age and older, living on a fixed limited income with some health and/or mobility limitations and adults, age 18 - 59, who have temporary or permanent functional limitations.
To find contact information about Snohomish and Pierce County services, click here.
advance-notice-notes: 1 week advanced notice required

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Visit the CCS Volunteer Services site to learn more

title: Community Ride - Auburn
description:
This reservation-based service operates Monday through Friday, 8:30 am – 4:00 pm. Auburn Community Ride picks you up and takes you to the store, a friend’s house, medical appointments, errands or anywhere you need to go within the Auburn city limits, then takes you home afterwards. The van takes scheduled trips to:
Monday through Friday – Auburn Senior Center for lunch
	Tuesday mornings – Fred Meyer
	Wednesday mornings – Walmart/The Outlet Collection
	Thursday mornings – Auburn Food Bank
	Friday afternoons – Fred Meyer
advance-notice-notes: Before the noon the previous day is the latest you can reserve. It is recommended that you reserve a ride 3 business days beforehand. Seniors can reserve rides up to seven calendar days in advance.

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Visit Sound Generations' site here for more information

title: Community Ride - Black Diamond Enumclaw
description:
The Community Ride service in Black Diamond and Enumclaw is a reservation-based Demand Response shuttle bus that operates Monday through Friday, 6:30 am â 4:30 pm. Community Ride picks you up and takes you where you need to go in select areas of Black Diamond and Enumclaw.
Visit here for a map of the flexible service areas in Black Diamond and Enumclaw
Visit here for a King County Metro route description
advance-notice-notes:
Reserve your ride at least two hours (or up to 30 days) before your pick up time. You can call:
Weekdays between 5 am - 11 pm
Saturdays: 7:30 am - 9:30 pm
Sundays: 9:30 am - 6:30 pm

cost-senior: for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Visit the Hopelink reservation page to book a ride

title: Community Transit
description: Community Transit is a Snohomish County transportation agency providing bus, paratransit and vanpool services as well as commuter service to Seattle. Local buses operate Mondays through Saturdays. Commuter buses to downtown Seattle, the University of Washington in Seattle and Boeing operate weekdays only.
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: Local RRFP: $1.00                     Commuter/South RRFP: $2.00                Commuter/North-East RRFP: $2.50
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts:
Use ORCA card to transfer fare value from other providers.
RRFP is a reduced fare bus pass that is available to people 65 years or older, and/or people living with disabilities. The card allows riders to save over 50 percent on trips using public transit.
To see if you qualify for this program, go to http://metro.kingcounty.gov/
website: Visit the Community Transit website to learn more

title: Community Transit - Dial-A-Ride-Transportation (DART)
description: DART, a program of Senior Services of Snohomish County, operates under a contract to Community Transit to provide safe, reliable, and friendly ADA paratransit transportation throughout Community Transit's service area. DART is designed to transport people whose condition or disability prevents them from using Community Transit's regular fixed-route system. Trips can be made for any reason, such as health care, employment, shopping, senior centers, schools, recreation, social activities and more. DART can take you to any destination located within ¾ of a mile of any Community Transit local bus route, within the hours the bus route operates in the area.
advance-notice-notes: Pre-qualification through Functional Assessment is needed.  May need information from a doctor or other person who knows about your condition. May also need you to meet with someone who can look at your ability to use the regular bus.

cost-senior: for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Visit the Dial-A-Ride website to learn more

title: Community Transit Van Pool
description:
A vanpool is a group of 5-15 commuters who ride to work together in a van provided by Community Transit. Vanpools generally follow a set schedule and route, but unlike a bus, these are set by the riders themselves. Fares are based on the size of the van and the daily round-trip mileage. Fares cover all gas, maintenance and insurance.
Community Transit vanpools must begin or end in Snohomish County.
advance-notice-notes: Setting up or joining a vanpool takes planning ahead of time, but is easy to coordinate after joining. Visit www.rideshareonline.org to find an open vanpool.

cost-senior: See website for more details
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Visit the Community Transit site here to learn more

title: DAV Transportation Network- American Lake VA
description: DAV (Disabled American Veterans) operates a fleet of vehicles around the country driven by volunteers to provide free transportation to VA medical facilities for veterans. Veteran riders must be ambulatory. Use the DAV Hospital Service Coordinator Directory phone number provided below to contact your nearest HSC for information or assistance.
advance-notice-notes: 5 business day advanced notice required.                   6:00am - 8:30am pickups for VA appointments between 9:00 -2:00pm(appointment completion).

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Visit the Disabled American Veterans site

title: DAV Transportation Network- Seattle VA
description: DAV (Disabled American Veterans) operates a fleet of vehicles around the country driven by volunteers to provide free transportation to VA medical facilities for veterans. Veteran riders must be ambulatory. Use the DAV Hospital Service Coordinator Directory phone number provided below to contact your nearest HSC for information or assistance.
advance-notice-notes: 5 business day advanced notice required.                   7:00am - 8:30am pickups for VA appointments between 9:30am - 12:15pm. No Seattle transportation service last Friday of month.

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Visit the Disabled American Veterans site

title: Duvall Community Van
description:
Community Van is a new rideshare pilot program brought to you by King County and participating cities (currently Duvall) to provide community members with a new way to share the ride. This is the latest in a series of unique alternative services Metro is piloting in communities throughout King County. These services are designated to provide residents with customized options for getting around when bus service canât meet their needs.
Community members travel together to local destinations throughout the day, evening and weekends.
Group trips and stops are preplanned ahead of time by a Community Transportation Coordinator.
Riders contact their Community Transportation Coordinator to find pre-scheduled Community Van trips or see trips on this page posted by others.
Trips must have at least two passengers in addition to the volunteer driver. Each rider will pay a one-zone Metro fare while the driver travels for free.
Riders request a trip through the listed trip contact or Community Transportation Coordinator. They can be reached at communityvan@kingcounty.gov, or by calling (206) 625-4500; let us know about your trip ideas and what you need before you plan your trip.
advance-notice-notes: Contact the Community Transportation Coordinator for details.

cost-adult: $2.75. ORCA LIFT $1.50/ Driver rides for FREE
cost-senior: for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Riders pay a Metro bus one-zone fare for the trip. Drivers ride for FREE.
website: Visit the Community Van site to learn more

title: East County Senior Center Shuttle Bus
description: Snohomish County East County Senior Center offers a three-day per week (Mondays, Thursdays & Fridays) transportation program for seniors (60+) and younger individuals with disabilities living in Monroe and the surrounding unincorporated area. This door-to-door service provides access to shopping, medical appointments, socializing and other activities. Service requires approval of a registration form and a telephone call to schedule. The program is free with a $1.50 donation suggested. Their shuttle-bus is equipped with a wheelchair lift. The bus can accommodate two wheelchairs.
advance-notice-notes: Recommended to call 24 hours to a week in advance to be sure to get a ride

cost-senior: 60+: recommended $1.50 donation
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

service-area: 8 mile radius from Senior Center location
website: Visit the East County Senior Center site for more information

title: Eastside Friends of Seniors
description:
Eastside Friends of Seniors helps seniors maintain their independence. Their volunteer transportation program provides rides for clients 60 years and older to medical appointments, shopping and errands, and social visits, to name a few. In order to receive services, seniors must go through a client application process. Call the number listed below for more information.
Service area not shown on map: Fall City
ELIGIBILITY DISCLAIMER: This provider only serves seniors, and does not serve younger adults with disabilities. Limited availability for rides on weekends.
advance-notice-notes: 1-2 weeks advanced notice preferred

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

service-hours: 8:00 am - 5:00 pm. Scheduling limited to volunteer availability.

description: Provides transportation for seniors 55 year of age and older traveling to and from the senior center for activities, presentations, medical appointments, and/or lunch. Local (Enumclaw only) trips throughout the community such as the grocery store, hair salon, bank, and others also available. Contact the center using the phone number provided below to confirm details and boundaries.

description:
We'll help you get where you need to go.
The Greater Maple Valley Community Center Van provides rides to and from the community center for individuals 50 years of age and older, who have a disability, or with limited income. Service is available Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.
advance-notice-notes: 24 hours advanced notice required

title: Greyhound Bus Service
description: The largest provider of intercity bus service, serving 3800 destinations in the United States and Canada. Any passenger under the age of 8 must be accompanied by a passenger at least 15 years of age or older at all times. Children twelve years of age and older will be charged an adult fare.
advance-notice-notes: 3 hours

cost-senior: Varies

title: Homage Senior Services of Snohomish County - Pay Your Pal
description:
Pay Your Pal provides a safe and economical way to receive transportation services for people with disabilities. Riders eligible for this program live in rural Snohomish county or areas not served by public transit, have a disability, and need transportation to medical appointments, work, or school programs or events.
Riders must fill out an application and prove that they are eligible for these services. Eligible riders find friends or family to drive them. These drivers must be insured, licensed and their vehicles fully operational and safe to ride in. Each volunteer driver is given a mileage reimbursement.
Call today to find out if you qualify as a rider, and if your family member or friend qualifies as a driver!
advance-notice-notes: You and your driver must be eligible. Then, you can apply the reimbursement.

cost-senior: N/A
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Payment is voluntary
website: Visit the Pay your Pal site to learn more

title: Homage Senior Services of Snohomish County-Transportation Assistance Program
description:
Senior Services of Snohomish County Transportation Assistance Program (TAP) provides a special needs transportation safety net for older adults and people with disabilities outside the Community Transit Dial-a-Ride (DART) service area. TAP connects people to services, health care, senior centers, shopping, recreation and more.
We go any place that Community Transit DART or Everett Paratransit doesn't go. (Rural areas)
Office hours to call: 8:00 am - 5:00 pm.
Call today to complete the application process and find out if you are eligible.
advance-notice-notes:
Call a minimum of 2-3 days before; the best time frame is: 1 week-10 days to schedule.
No nights and no weekends.

cost-senior: $1.75 one way
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts:
$1.50 for Seniors and people w/ disabilities.
Pay $35 and get 20 rides.
website: Visit the TAP site to learn more

description:
In partnership with the Healthcare Authority (HCA) of Washington State, Hopelink coordinates transportation to and from medical appointments for low income residents on Medicaid assistance. To schedule a ride you will need the following:
Provider One Number
Name of medical provider
Name, address and phone number of medical facility
Appointment date and time
Reason for the appointment ​
advance-notice-notes: 2 business days advance notice required

description: KP School Bus Connects uses empty school buses to transport riders to Key Center, Lake Kathryn, Volunteer Park, KPCS Food Bank, Local stops and Purdy Park and Ride, and Peninsula High School. Riders under 12 must be accompanied by an adult.
advance-notice-notes: Advanced notice required for afternoon route pickups beyond Lake Kathryn Village.

cost-senior: Free

title: King County Metro Access
description:
If you are eligible for the ADA Paratransit Program, Access can take you anywhere a Metro bus or Sound Transit light rail goes. Access customers go grocery shopping, to work and school, to get their hair cut, to check in with their doctor, to meet up with friends, or enjoy a local park.
You must be found eligible for the ADA Paratransit Program before you can request rides on Access. 
For determine if you qualify, visit the eligibility website. You can also email the program at Access.CustomerService@kingcounty.gov, or call the numbers provided below.
advance-notice-notes: 1-3 days advanced notice required.

cost-senior: for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Personal care attendants and designated service animals ride free.
website: Visit the main Access site to learn more

title: King County Metro Commuter Shuttle Route 628
description:
On weekdays, Community Shuttle Route 628 operates about every 30 minutes between 5-8 am and 5-9 pm. It runs on a fixed route to and from North Bend and the Issaquah Highlands P&R via Snoqualmie and Snoqualmie Ridge, and also provides service on request at designated stops within a flexible service area in the Issaquah Highlands.
Shuttles operate from 5 a.m. to 8 a.m. and from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. Monday through Friday.
Morning service runs westbound from North Bend, Snoqualmie, Snoqualmie Ridge and Issaquah Highlands (including the flexible service area in Issaquah Highlands), and then functions as an express route on Interstate 90 from Issaquah Highlands to North Bend.
Afternoon service runs eastbound from Issaquah Highlands Park-and-Ride and flexible service area to Snoqualmie Ridge, Snoqualmie, North Bend, and then functions as express service on Interstate 90 from North Bend to Issaquah Highlands.
Standard weekday peak/off-peak fares are charged.
Full-size route map
ORCA LIFT site
RRFP site
advance-notice-notes:
To schedule service within the Issaquah Highlands flexible service area, call:

855-233-6043

cost-senior: $1.00 with Regional Reduced Fare Pass (RRFP)
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts:
Accepts ORCA card, ORCA LIFT, RRFP and Metro transfers.The ORCA LIFT card is a reduced fare bus pass that is available to income-qualified individuals. The card allows riders to save 50 percent or more on trips using participating public transit agencies. 
RRFP is a reduced fare bus pass that is available to people 65 years or older, and/or people living with disabilities. The card allows riders to save over 50 percent on trips using public transit.
To see if you qualify for either of these programs, visit the links in the description above.
website: Visit the King County Metro site to learn more

title: King County Metro TripPool
description:
TripPool is a King County Metro pilot program providing on-demand rideshare options to connect riders to transit in select areas. Metro provided commuter vans make one round trip each work day to a Park & Ride or transit center. Volunteer drivers pick up and drop off registered riders along the way. TripPool trips are coordinated by riders and drivers on their smartphone through the free mobile app, iCarpool.
 
TripPool is a pilot program being tested by Metro in alternative service areas—currently seeking volunteer drivers on Mercer Island.
Request information  or call 206-625-4500.


TripPool Fast Facts:
Each TripPool has at least two drivers to ensure reliability. The Metro provided vehicle includes gas, insurance, and maintenance along with the reserved parking.
Riders use iCarpool to choose from listed stops and drivers have the flexibility to make route adjustments.
Trip booking and fare payment is handled through the iCarpool mobile app.
TripPool trips are free for the active driver of the trip.
Riders pay for trips using iCarpool ‘ride credits’.
Free ride credits and program incentives will be provided to riders who link their iCarpool and RideshareOnline.com accounts. For all TripPool trips, linked accounts are reimbursed for fares above $2.75 (one-zone peak).
Additional ride credits will be provided to riders who also provide their ORCA card to allow 100% reimbursement for all TripPool trips.
Accessible commuter vans are available. Please call 206-625-4500 to discuss your accessible vehicle needs for your TripPool trip.
advance-notice-notes: TripPool users can schedule their ride through the iCarpool App in the morning of your ride!
discounts: Link your iCarpool account to a free ridematch account at RideshareOnline.com to be eligible for great rewards. Provide your ORCA card number on your RideshareOnline.com account and get 100% reimbursement for all TripPool trips linking to transit.
service-area: Available throughout King County to various Park & Ride Lots.
website: Vist the King County Metro TripPool site

title: King County Metro VanPool
description: King County Metro's VanPool is a way for 5-15 commuters to share a King County VanPool vehicle to reduce the cost of commuting alone. VanPools can take advantage of fast carpool lanes and a low monthly fare. To connect with VanPool drivers and riders, visit RideMatch and find rides today!

title: Lyft
description:
Lyft is a private peer to peer ride-sharing service accessible through the free Lyft mobile phone application, similar to a taxi service. By accessing the Lyft application, users can request a ride to any desired location in the service area by notifying a nearby driver to come pick them up at their current location. Payment is only available with a credit card.
For more information and access to the downloadable application click here.
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: Mileage + Time + $1.35 Base Fare
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

title: Mercy Transportation
description: Mercy Transportation provides non-emergency medical transportation throughout all of western Washington. Accept Medicaid, DSHS, L & I, Visa, MasterCard and American Express. We offer Wheelchair pick up. There is NO EXTRA FEE for a family member or care giver to ride along.

title: Northshore Senior Center Transportation
description:
Access to safe, reliable, efficient, and affordable transportation for older adults and people with disabilities. Rides to medical care, groceries, or activities at our senior centers, prevents isolation and improves quality of life. In the Northshore community, transportation is a basic need.
Q. How do I request a ride? A. Phone during our reservation hours: 8a - 5p. Have the following information ready:
Your name
Your phone number
Your complete pick-up address, including apartment or unit number
Description and exact address of where you want to go
Time and date you would like to travel
Times of any appointments you might have, so we can plan your drop-off and pick-up times.
If an escort or guest will be riding with you
Whether you will be using an aid, such as a wheelchair, walker or oxygen
advance-notice-notes: 1-14 days advance notice required. You can request a ride from one business day before your ride up to two weeks in advance.  Requests are accepted on a first come, first served basis.

cost-senior: Free - Donation Suggested
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://www.northshoreseniorcenter.org/programsservices/transportation/overview.aspx

title: Northwest Transport Inc
description: We specialize in these transportation needs: Ambulatory, Non Ambulatory, Wheelchair, Electric Chairs & Power Chair &  Scooters, Door to Door Service Transportation, Non Emergency Transport.
advance-notice-notes: 24 hours advanced notice required

cost-senior: Flat Rate + Mileage
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://www.nwt1cabulance.com/

title: Orange Cab
description:
Taxi services in and around the Puget Sound Area.
Book online.
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: Meter
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: 50% off fares with Metro Taxi Scrip.
website: http://orangecab.net/

title: PCCC - Beyond the Borders Transportation
description:
Beyond the Borders helps eligible residents access public transportation, medical services, employment, shopping, and social activities. People who are ages 12 - 17, seniors 65 years or older, people with disabilities, and people with low incomes may be eligible for this transportation service.  The free program includes two services: fixed route connector buses in Sumner and Spanaway/South Hill and demand-response transportation in South and East Pierce county. 
Demand Response eligibility is limited to:
• Work/Employment locations (maximum ride total of $750 per person per month).
• Dialysis treatment (must meet income criteria) - Call to check their wait list.
• Other destinations (must be essential/lifeline destinations) – Up to 3 trips per month per rider.
advance-notice-notes: All riders must complete an eligibility screening to take advantage of the service. Please call at least 24 hours in advance to book a ride with the demand response service.

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

service-area: Pierce County: Bonney Lake, Buckley, Burnett, Carbonado, Cascade Junction, Eatonville, Frederickson, Graham, Kapowsin, Lake Tapps, McKenna, Orting, Prairie Ridge, Roy, South Hill, South Prairie, Spanaway, Sumner and Wilkeson.
website: http://www.co.pierce.wa.us/index.aspx?NID=1269

title: Paratransit Services Medicaid Transportation
description:
Paratransit Services provides Non-Emergency Medical Transportation (NEMT) brokerage services for Pierce County under contract with the State of Washington's Health Care Authority (HCA). The Broker schedules transportation services for eligible Medicaid clients by seeking the most cost effective means of transportation that meets the client's needs. Riders must get a DSHS Medical ID Card which you use to pay for your medical visits.
What types of transportation services are available?
We arrange the lowest cost, most suitable transportation for your needs, including : Bus Passes or Tickets ; Gas Vouchers ; Volunteer Drivers ; Shared Ride and Cabulance.
advance-notice-notes: Please call our office at least 2 business days before your medical appointment. Call between 7:00 am and 7:00 pm, Monday through Friday. Call at least 2 weeks in advance to order bus passes or ferry tickets.

cost-senior: Medicaid Clients Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Free to Washington Apple Health (Medicaid) patients.
website: http://www.paratransit.net/nemt.html

title: Peter Kirk Community Center Shuttle
description:
Daily Van Transportation
The Center's van is operated by the Northshore Senior Center Monday - Friday. Transportation to and from the center is for City of Kirkland residents only. Participants must be Access eligible to participate in this program.
Grocery Shopping
	The Center provides weekly transportation to and from local grocery stores. Shopping times are determined by the geographical location of your home.
advance-notice-notes: 24 hours advanced notice required

cost-senior: for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://www.kirklandwa.gov/depart/parks/About_Parks_and_Community_Services/Senior_Services/Van_Service_Trip.htm

title: Pierce Transit
description: Bus Service for Pierce County with connections to Seattle
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: $ 1.00 or  All Day Pass: $2.50
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts:
RRFP is a reduced fare bus pass that is available to people 65 years or older, and/or people living with disabilities. The card allows riders to save over 50 percent on trips using public transit.
To see if you qualify for this program, go to http://metro.kingcounty.gov/
website: http://www.piercetransit.org/

title: Pierce Transit Community Solutions Mini-Bus - The Mustard Seed Project
description:
The Mustard Seed Project, in partnership with Pierce Transit, runs a wheelchair accessible minibus piloted by volunteer drivers. The route regularly drops off riders at Key Peninsula Community Services' Senior Lunch, Gig Harbor HOPE Senior Center, and the YMCA for those who register ahead of time. Other benefits of early booking include off route stops and additional stops along the main route.
Riders must live on the Key Peninsula. A minimum of 25% of mini-bus trips are for ADA eligible individuals.
For more information on the service, please contact Maureen Reilly, the Transportation Coordinator at (253) 884-2216

cost-senior: Free (60+)
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Click here for more information

title: Pierce Transit SHUTTLE (paratransit)
description: SHUTTLE is a shared-ride service for people who, because of their disability, are unable to ride a regular Pierce Transit bus. SHUTTLE provides door- to-door service, or in some instances, transportation to transit centers or bus stops to connect with regular bus service. The SHUTTLE vehicle may make several stops along the way before it arrives at your destination. To receive SHUTTLE transportation, you must meet the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) requirements and meet eligibility requirements.
advance-notice-notes: Once your eligibility is confirmed, you may request rides. Reservation hours are 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. seven days a week including holidays.

cost-senior: $ 1.00 each time passenger boards
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

service-area: Any location within 3/4 of a mile of any local Pierce Transit bus route
website: http://www.piercetransit.org/shuttle/

title: Providence ElderPlace Shuttle
description: King County Providence operates 17 lift-equipped vehicles and 3 mini-vans to transport seniors 55+ throughout King County to the ElderPlace Center for day health and doctor visits including dentistry, optometry, podiatry, rehab, and mental health appointments. Providence ElderPlace also transports its participants to specialist appointments and picks them up when they are discharged from the hospital. You must be a Providence ElderPlace member to receive these services. Visit the website to learn if you are eligible to join.
advance-notice-notes: Once you are a member and you schedule an appointment, a Providence representative will handle scheduling your ride.

cost-adult: Dependent upon income - call for more information
cost-senior: Dependent upon income - call for more information
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Visit the Providence ElderCare site for more information

title: Puget Sound Cabulance
description:
Puget Sound Cabulance is a 24/7, ambulatory and wheelchair, non-emergency medical transportation service. Vans and sedans available.
We take your family door-to-door wherever they need to go, with expert medical service personnel by their side. Our service is specifically tailored for wheelchair-bound, elderly and/or disabled individuals.
advance-notice-notes: Must call the day of your trip

cost-senior: Flat Rate + Mileage
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Select areas have a flat rate. Call to confirm.
website: http://www.pugetsoundcabulance.com/services.php

title: Puget Sound ESD Road to Independence
description: Puget Sound ESD Road to Independence is a no-cost transportation program for low income-special needs and Veterans.  The program serves the North Pierce, as well as South King County areas, offering no cost rides to people to and from work sites.
advance-notice-notes: Call at least 48 hours prior to pickup. Program enrollment to be completed at least one month prior to service use.

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: This program provides rides to work and employment-related activities for eligible participants in East Pierce County and South King County.
website: Puget Sound ESD Road to Independence

title: Rainier Foothills Wellness Foundation Care Van
description: FREE service to anyone who demonstrates a transportation hardship for healthcare transporting needs. Operates Monday/Wednesday/Friday from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM and Tuesday/Thursday from 9:00 AM to 2:00 PM. A $5 donation is suggested. The service area includes Enumclaw, Black Diamond, Buckley, Wilkeson, and Carbonado.
advance-notice-notes: Please call at least 2 days in advance to schedule
website: Rainier Foothills Wellness Foundation Care Van

title: Redmond LOOP
description: A neighborhood shuttle developed through a partnership between the City of Redmond and King County Metro which typically travels in a fixed route, but includes flexible service areas and destinations. The LOOP shuttle is designed for local travel and offers a convenient way to access destinations in Downtown Redmond, Avondale, Southeast Redmond, and Education Hill. Typical Metro fares apply for all trips.
advance-notice-notes: No need to call ahead if you plan on riding the fixed route. The LOOP is able to deviate off of the fixed route, but you must call (425) 702-9616 or email LOOP@redmond.gov at least 2 hours before you want to be picked up. Limited number of trips are available (first-come, first-served basis).
discounts: The Redmond LOOP is free until September 12th. After that, regular Metro fare will apply. ORCA LIFT and ORCA RRFP will be accepted.
website: Redmond LOOP

title: STITA Taxi
description: STITA Taxi serves all of King County except Seattle with over 100 Prius hybrids and CNG-fueled vehicles and ADA passenger vans.  Payment options include Metro Scrips and Taxi Scrips.
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: Meter
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Metro Taxi Scrip accepted.
website: http://www.stitataxi.com/

title: Seattle Cancer Care Alliance Shuttle
description:
Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (SCCA) operates a free shuttle for patients and families between the SCCA Clinic on Lake Union, the University of Washington Medical Center, Seattle Children's Hospital, and their two housing facilities--SCCA house and the Pete Gross house. For up-to-date schedules, visit here.
When does my shuttle arrive? 

You can now text SCCA stop numbers to 41411 and receive shuttle arrival times. Text "scca 1" if you're waiting at SCCA Clinic, text "scca 2" if you're at UWMC, or text "scca 3" if you're at Seattle Children's. It's that easy! For rider alerts and route maps, visit transportation.uw.edu/uwshuttles or call 206-685-3146.
advance-notice-notes: No advance notice needed.

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Seattle Cancer Care Alliance

title: Seattle Center Monorail
description: An elevated train that serves between Westlake Center and Seattle Center in Seattle
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Discounts available on group tickets of 125+.
service-area: Downtown Seattle - Seattle Center to Westlake Center
website: http://www.seattlemonorail.com/

title: Seattle Street Car
description: A street car that serves between Westlake Center and South Lake Union in Seattle.
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: $1.00 with Regional Reduced Fare Pass (RRFP)
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts:
Accepts ORCA card, RRFP, and Metro transfers.The ORCA LIFT card is a reduced fare bus pass that is available to income-qualified individuals. The card allows riders to save 50 percent or more on trips using participating public transit agencies. 
RRFP is a reduced fare bus pass that is available to people 65 years or older, and/or people living with disabilities. The card allows riders to save over 50 percent on trips using public transit.
To see if you qualify for either of these programs, go to http://metro.kingcounty.gov/
service-hours: M-Th 6 a - 9 p. F-Sa 6 a - 11p. Su-Holidays 10a - 7p
website: http://www.seattlestreetcar.org/

title: Seattle Yellow Cab
description:
Use Mobile app to find one of 380 taxis. Available for iPhone or Android. Serving King County, Seattle and surrounding communities. They accept King County Metro Taxi Scrip Program, which serves low-income King County residents age 18 to 64 with disabilities or those age 65 and over. 
To book your ride online, click here.
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: Meter
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: 50% off fares with Metro Taxi Scrip.
website: http://www.seattleyellowcab.com/

title: Shuttle Express
description:
Shuttle Express provides stress-free transportation to/from SeaTac Airport or anywhere! We’ll take care of you with friendly drivers and caring service―we have many transportation services to meet your needs, including SeaTac Airport transfers, luxury town cars, tours, and charter bus transportation.
We pick you up from your home, hotel, office, train station, cruise terminal, or airport. Shuttle Express also offers private group transportation services throughout our service area, including King, Pierce and Snohomish counties.
Book your trip online by clicking here.
advance-notice-notes: 24 hours notice for non-ADA vehicle.  72 hours notice for ADA-equiped vehicle

cost-senior: Meter
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Active duty military personnel are offered a 10% discount when showing proof of military status to your driver.
service-area: To/From Airport or Point to Point
website: www.shuttleexpress.com

title: Snoqualmie Valley Transportation - Demand Response
description:
Snoqualmie Valley Transportation Demand Response Service picks you up at your location and takes you to your destination. The service covers North Bend, Snoqualmie, Fall City, and Preston with door-to-door service. All buses are lift-equipped and serve seniors, riders with special needs, and the general public. Riders under 13 years must be accompanied by an adult. Rides are shared and there is a 15 minute service window before and after the scheduled time.
To request a ride call us 1 - 7 days in advance, call early for priority booking, and call prior to your ride to confirm your scheduled time. Click here for more tips on how to make your ride a success.
For more detailed information on available service area, visit the website or call the number provided.
advance-notice-notes: 1-7 days advance notice required

cost-senior: for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://svtbus.org/services/#DemandResponse

title: Snoqualmie Valley Transportation - The Loop
description:
As a part of the Snoqualmie Valley Transportation demand response service, the Loop is a bus that circulates throughout the downtown cores of Snoqualmie and North Bend. The loop takes about 45 minutes to complete, usually departing from Mt. Si Senior center at the top of the hour and includes popular destinations such as QFC, Safeway and the Senior Center in North Bend, and Snoqualmie Casino. Riders under 13 must be accompanied by an adult. 
This service does not operate on a fixed schedule, and also can perform door-to-door, demand response service in North Bend and Snoqualmie if you call in advance. If you are using a regular stop, there is no need to schedule in advance. You may call to find out the next arrival time to your stop.
advance-notice-notes: There is no advance notice requirement for riding The Loop.  If you want to be picked up or dropped off at a location other than a stop, you must call ahead.

cost-senior: for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://svtbus.org/services/#Downtown_Loop

title: Snoqualmie Valley Transportation - Valley Shuttle
description:
As a part of the Snoqualmie Valley Transportation, the Valley Shuttle is a deviated fixed-route bus. The Valley Shuttle circulates throughout Snoqualmie Valley but also has the ability to deviate from the regular route and do door-to-door service if two hours of advance notice is given. The shuttle connects riders to Metro bus stops between North Bend, Snoqualmie, Fall City, Carnation, and Duvall. To see the Valley Shuttle timetable click here.
To use this service, simply stand at one of the many Metro bus stops. When the bus comes, make sure to confirm with the driver if the shuttle is north or south bound. The driver will announce stops verbally as they arrive. If you are in Duvall or North Bend and you need the bus to deviate from its regular route, please call in advance and SVT will try to arrange it for you.
For more information about Valley Shuttle and to see the shuttle's route click here.
advance-notice-notes: There is no advance notice requirement for riding the Valley Shuttle. If you are in Duvall or North Bend and you need us to get the bus a bit closer to where you are at either end of the route, you may call Snoqualmie Valley Transportation at least 2 hours ahead of time and they will try to arrange it.

cost-senior: $1 suggested donation
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://svtbus.org/services/

title: Solid Ground Downtown Circulator Bus
description:
FREE rides on our Downtown Circulator Bus for people living on low incomes and those who access health and human services in the downtown area.
You may email them.
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: https://www.solid-ground.org/our-impact/transportation/

• People with disabilities
• Seniors 55 or better
 
You may email them.

title: Sound Generations Volunteer Transportation Program
description:
Volunteer driver service for seniors 60+ through Sound Generations. Volunteers wait with clients at appointments.
Who is Eligible?
• Persons 60 years or better
• Residents of King County
• Persons able to transfer into a private vehicle with minimal assistance
• Persons who cannot use other transportation options
 
ELIGIBILITY DISCLAIMER: To be eligible for this service you must be 60 year or older, this service does not provide rides for younger adults with disabilities.
advance-notice-notes: Call on or before the Wednesday of the week before your trip.

cost-senior: Free- Suggested $6 Donation
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://www.seniorservices.org/transportation/VolunteerTransportation.aspx

title: Sound Transit Express Bus
description:
Commuter bus service for King, Snohomish, and Pierce counties
This service accepts transfers from other agencies while using an ORCA card, but does not accept paper transfers from other providers, such as King County Metro buses or Community Transit buses.
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: $.75 - $1.50 with Regional Reduced Fare Pass (RRFP)
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts:
Use ORCA card to transfer fare value from other providers.
RRFP is a reduced fare bus pass that is available to people 65 years or older, and/or people living with disabilities. The card allows riders to save over 50 percent on trips using public transit.
To see if you qualify for this program, go to http://metro.kingcounty.gov/
website: http://www.soundtransit.org/Rider-Guide/ST-Express-bus

title: Sound Transit Seattle LINK Light Rail
description: Central Link light rail travels between University of Washington light rail station and Angle Lake south of Sea-Tac Airport, making 16 stops along the way. Link trains run every 6, 10 or 15 minutes depending on the time of day.
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: $1.00 with Regional Reduced Fare Pass (RRFP)
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts:
All day pass available, ORCA card transfers accepted. The ORCA LIFT card is a reduced fare bus pass that is available to income-qualified individuals. The card allows riders to save 50 percent or more on trips using participating public transit agencies. 
RRFP is a reduced fare bus pass that is available to people 65 years or older, and/or people living with disabilities. The card allows riders to save over 50 percent on trips using public transit.
To see if you qualify for either of these programs, go to http://metro.kingcounty.gov/
service-area: University of Washington  to SeaTac Airport
website: http://www.soundtransit.org/Rider-Guide/Link-light-rail

description:
Commuter Rail serving King, Snohomish, and Pierce counties.
Click here to see a map of the Everett-Seattle Sounder Train
Click here to see a map of the Lakewood-Seattle Sounder Train

To see if you qualify for this program, go to http://metro.kingcounty.gov/

title: Sound Transit Tacoma Link Light Rail
description: Tacoma Link light rail travels 1.6 miles through downtown Tacoma, making six stops along the way. Link trains run every 12 to 24 minutes depending on the time of day. Service is available from 5:30 a.m. to 10 p.m. Monday through Friday, from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Saturday, and from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. on Sunday and holidays. Tacoma Link fares continue to be free thanks to funding from the Tacoma Business Improvement Area.
advance-notice-notes: None

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://www.soundtransit.org/Schedules/Tacoma-Link-light-rail?tab=Stations

title: Stillaguamish Tribe - Stillaguamish Tribal Transit Services (STTS)
description: STTS is a demand response transportation service offered by the Stillaguamish Tribe of Indians. STTS provides transportation services to a variety of native and non-native individuals who need to travel to native businesses and facilities, or to other service facilities in the northern Snohomish County area.

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://www.stillaguamish.com/transitservices.asp

title: Swedish Medical Center Optimal Aging Transportation
description: Swedish Medical Center has a contract with SafeRide and United Transportation to provide rides to seniors with medical appointments with Swedish Medical Center physicians. Medical appointments can be booked as soon as 24 hours in advance.
advance-notice-notes: If you need wheelchair service, it is a $42 surcharge for a one-way trip. Any trip beyond two miles with a wheelchair is $3.90 per mile on top of the $42. Three miles would be $45.90; four miles would be $49.80, etcetera.

cost-senior: $3.90 per mile
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: None
website: Visit the Optimal Aging site to learn more

title: Trailhead Direct
description: King County Metro's Trailhead Direct service is a pilot project sponsored by King County Parks and Metro's Community Connections program. The aim of the service is to reduce regional vehicle congestion, traffic along the I-90 corridor, and encourage hiking access to destinations in the Issaquah Alps and within reach of I-90. All Metro fares apply. The route connects to the Issaquah Transit Center and the Issaquah Highlands Park & Ride and shuttle to three trailheads. Trailhead Direct will operate during the fall August - October season on a trial basis.
advance-notice-notes: Bus arrives every 30 minutes

cost-senior: for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Up to four children (under age 5) may ride for free with one adult (19 and older) paying a full fare
phone: Metro Customer Service: 206-553-3000; or text: "King Trailhead Direct" to 468311
website: Read this Trailhead Direct PDF for more information

title: Transpro
description: Specializes in contract transportation. We serve veterans, older adults, youth and those with disabilities. Transpro provides transportation services in Washington, Montana, Idaho, and Oregon.  Transpro is contracted by the VA Puget Sound to provide cabulance services.
advance-notice-notes: Reservations made on space available basis. Prefer 2 days advance notice. Will attempt to provide transportation with less than 2 days notice.

cost-senior: Time + Mileage + Mobility Requirements
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

discounts: Inquire about discounts
website: http://www.transpro.org/

title: Tri-County Cabulance
description:
Tri-County Cabulance provides non-emergency specialty transportation for any occasion and covers all of King, Pierce and Snohomish Counties, including Seattle, Everett, Ballard, Bothell, Edmonds, Kirkland, Lynnwood, Mill Creek, North Seattle, Redmond and Shoreline.
Every Transport Includes:
• Room to check-in assistance
• Transport wheel chair included
• Up to 15 minute wait time
• No charge for stairs requiring single driver
advance-notice-notes: Must call the day of your trip

cost-senior: Flat Rate + Mileage
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://www.tricountycabulance.com/index.html

title: Tulalip Transit
description:
Tulalip Transit is rural public transportation designed to provide service to areas of the Tulalip Tribes Reservation that is not currently served. The goal of Tulalip Transit is to connect these un-served areas with the main transit line provided by Community Transit.
The Tribeâs commitment to service was born out of identifying the needs of the consumers of Tribal programs. The dedicated staff serves people of all ages. The service is open to the general public.
advance-notice-notes: Call ahead for route deviation

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://www.tulaliptribes-nsn.gov/Home/Community/TulalipTransit.aspx

title: Uber
description:
Uber is a private peer to peer ride-sharing service accessible through the free Uber mobile phone application. By accessing the Uber application, users can request a ride to any desired location in the service area by notifying a nearby driver to come pick them up at their current location. Payment is only available with a credit card.
To get a trip cost estimate or to download the app click here.

cost-senior: Mileage + Time + $1.35 Base Fare
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: www.uber.com

title: University of Washington Health Sciences Express
description:
The Health Sciences Express provides transportation between UW Medical Center and Harborview Medical Center, with stops at Roosevelt Clinic and UW Tower. Service is available to UW faculty, staff, students, as well as medical center patients and their families.
Buses depart UWMC every 15 minutes from 6 a.m. to 5:45 p.m., Monday - Friday, excluding University holidays. The extra evening service leaving UWMC at 6:15 p.m. and HMC at 7 p.m. is sponsored by Graduate Medical Education. Buses are equipped with wheelchair lifts and two-position bike racks.
Select medical commodities may be transported. See your department for eligibility. For further information, please call 206-685-3146 during office hours.
Lost and found
Call 206-685-3146 if you believe you left an item on one of our buses. Please be ready to provide your departure time and location when you think you lost your item, as well as a brief description and a way to reach you if it is found. Unclaimed items are sent to the HUB Lost and Found.
The Health Sciences Express bus service is supported by funding from University of Washington, UWMC and HMC. The Health Sciences Express Advisory Committee is under Health Sciences Administration, Office of the Executive Director. June 30, 1993.

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

service-area: UW Medical Center to Roosevelt Clinic to UW Tower to Harborview Medical Center
service-hours: 6 am - 5:45 pm; excluding University of Washington holidays--see website for more information.
website: University of Washington Health Sciences Express

title: VA- Veteran Transportation Service
description:
Veterans who are currently eligible for VA health care benefits and have a VA authorized appointment are eligible for the Veterans Health Administration's Veteran Transportation Service(VTS).
The VTS program is a new transportation program designed to serve remote and immobilized VA patients while supplementing existing benefits and programs to improve access to VA health care. The VA especially recognizes the problems veterans, who are visually impaired, elderly, or immobilized due to disease or disability, particularly those living in remote and rural areas, face in traveling to access VA health care. The program includes GPS-equipped accessible vehicles and new route-scheduling software.
To schedule a ride using the Veteran Transportation Service of the Puget Sound Healthcare System, call the number below.
advance-notice-notes: Please call to book a ride at least 5 business days before your appointment. VTS can only drive you to appointments which are scheduled for no earlier than 8 am, and for appointments that end no later than 1 pm.

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://www.pugetsound.va.gov/marrowtransplant/transportation.asp

title: Vashon Senior Center Bluebird Medical Transportation
description: Vashon Senior Center's Bluebird Medical Transportation program provides senior residents of Vashon Maury Island with free transportation to and from their medical appointments off the island. To be eligible for the free program you must be a resident of Vashon Island and you must be 55 years or older. Please call ahead of time to schedule your ride with a volunteer driver. The center is open Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday between 9 am and 3 pm. Also, when scheduling your doctor's appointments please schedule them to be no earlier than 10 am and no later than 2 pm in order to accommodate the Vashon Ferry schedule.
advance-notice-notes: Please call 1 week in advance before your doctor's appointment.

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: Visit the Vashon Center site for more information

title: Wallingford Community Senior Center Van Service
description: Wallingford Community Senior Center runs a van service for their clients Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. Anyone interested in participating in classes or eating lunch at the center can call the number for first-time riders and leave a message giving their name, address, phone number, date of ride, and activities they are participating in, and an appointment will be made. The van coordinator, Mark, will call clients the morning of the ride with the estimated pickup time. Anyone 50 years or older, or with limited mobility can qualify. You must live within Seattle City limits to use the van service.

cost-senior: $3 donation is encouraged
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: To learn more, visit the Wallingford Senior Center site

title: Water Taxi Shuttle DART # 773, 775
description:
Two FREE Metro DART shuttles operate between local
neighborhoods and the King County Water Taxi, when the
water taxi is in operation.
â˘ 773, West Seattle Junction
â˘ 775, Admiral District and Alki Avenue SW
Disclaimer: Route and hours of operation are subject to change in summer/winter seasons, see website to confirm details.
advance-notice-notes: There is no advance notice for riding the regular DART route.  This route has no deviations.

cost-senior: Free
for Seniors and people w/ disabilities

website: http://metro.kingcounty.gov/schedules/773/s0.html
